class.name: Compiler
class.javadoc:
The {@code Compiler} class is provided to support Java-to-native-code compilers and related services. By design, the {@code Compiler} class does nothing; it serves as a placeholder for a JIT compiler implementation.

When the Java Virtual Machine first starts, it determines if the system property {@code java.compiler} exists. (System properties are accessible through {@link System#getProperty(String)} and {@link System#getProperty(String,String)}. If so, it is assumed to be the name of a library (with a platform-dependent exact location and type); {@link System#loadLibrary} is called to load that library. If this loading succeeds, the function named {@code java_lang_Compiler_start()} in that library is called.

If no compiler is available, these methods do nothing. Frank Yellin JDK1.0

Compiles the specified class.
clazzA class
{@code true} if the compilation succeeded; {@code false} if the compilation failed or no compiler is available
NullPointerExceptionIf {@code clazz} is {@code null}

Compiles all classes whose name matches the specified string.
stringThe name of the classes to compile
{@code true} if the compilation succeeded; {@code false} if the compilation failed or no compiler is available
NullPointerExceptionIf {@code string} is {@code null}

Examines the argument type and its fields and perform some documented operation. No specific operations are required.
anyAn argument
A compiler-specific value, or {@code null} if no compiler is available
NullPointerExceptionIf {@code any} is {@code null}
Cause the Compiler to resume operation.
Cause the Compiler to cease operation.
